intro: Zoegea mesopotamica, commonly known as the Mesopotamian zoegea, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it resilient in harsh environments. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in semi-arid ecosystems.
